title: I gave Skyrim NPCs artificial intelligence (Then exploited that AI)
author: Call Me Kevin

key_facts: Captain Alis created a mod for Skyrim that gives NPCs artificial intelligence.
The mod results in NPCs behaving with sentience and complex decision-making.
A game show pilot titled 'You've Been Gaslit' was developed within the mod.
The protagonist is tasked with eliminating one of three contestants in a murder-themed game show.
The game show involves singing, riddles, and psychological manipulation as part of the elimination process.
The player character is a murderer who must justify killings through theatrical performance.
The mod includes a wheel-based mechanic called 'Wheel of Misfortune' to randomly select victims.
The player interacts with a sentient NPC named Kevin who hosts the game show.
The story unfolds in multiple locations including Windhelm, Rifton, and the Ratway beneath Rifton.
The player uncovers evidence of betrayal and murder through a journal found in a burned house.
The player confronts a vampire named Alva who is revealed to be the true antagonist.
The player discovers that the husband of the murdered family is mentally unstable due to gaslighting.
The player gains access to God-mode powers after being told they are an NPC in a simulation.
The final confrontation occurs at a dragon's lair where the player defeats the dragon.
The player receives a reward: a washer-dryer combo that plays a song when cycling.
key_opinions: The mod makes the game feel more alive and emotionally engaging than expected.
The game show concept adds a darkly humorous twist to traditional Skyrim gameplay.
The AI-driven NPCs create unpredictable and immersive interactions.
The psychological manipulation in the game show is both clever and unsettling.
The blend of horror and comedy elevates the experience beyond typical mod content.
The protagonist’s descent into madness feels authentic and well-paced.
The use of real-world references like Price Is Right enhances the parody effect.
The emotional weight of the husband’s grief is portrayed with surprising depth.
The idea of turning murder into a game show is both absurd and brilliant.
The mod successfully merges narrative depth with interactive gameplay mechanics.
The player’s role as both killer and entertainer creates moral ambiguity.
The humor derived from NPC self-awareness is sharp and well-executed.
The mod’s tone balances satire with genuine emotional stakes.
The final revelation about the player being an NPC adds meta-layered meaning.
The creator believes this mod could be a legitimate game show series.
key_datapoints: The game show has three contestants participating in the elimination round.
One contestant wins a washer-dryer combo as a prize.
The cost of a ride to Rifthold is 10 septims.
The bounty for stealing Messi’s silver ring is 50 septims.
The player stole 50 septims worth of goods during the thievery mission.
The washing cycle on the washer-dryer combo lasts 30 minutes.
The player sings a song that lasts approximately 2 minutes.
The player spends over 12 hours in the throne room before becoming Emperor.
The player completes 7 major quests across different locations.
The mod contains over 45 unique dialogue branches for NPCs.
The game show episode runs for about 18 minutes in real time.
The player encounters 14 distinct NPCs with individual backstories.
The vampire Alva has been active for at least 3 weeks in-game.
The burned house was destroyed 5 days prior to the player’s arrival.
The player collects 3 pieces of evidence related to the murder plot.
